content: Military camp in SingaporeThis article **relies largely or entirely on a single source**. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources. *Find sources:* "Chong Pang Camp" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2018)* 1°25′55.75″N 103°49′30.95″E﻿ / ﻿1.4321528°N 103.8252639°E﻿ / 1.4321528; 103.8252639 **Chong Pang Camp** is located in the northern side of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), within [Sembawang Air Base](/wiki/Sembawang_Air_Base) and opposite [Chong Pang City](/wiki/Chong_Pang) in [Yishun](/wiki/Yishun). Established in 2002, the camp is operated by the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force) (RSAF). The camp houses elements from [Air Defence Operations Command](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force#Air_Defence_&_Operations_Command_(ADOC)) (HQ ADOC, 165 Squadron, 809 and 819 Squadrons and 9 Air Engineering and Logistics Group) and [Participation Command](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force#Participation_Command_(PC)) (HQ PC, 3DA, 6/9 DA and 18 DA Battalions, 105 Squadron and 1 Medical Squadron). The camp was originally known as the Air Defence Systems Division (ADSD) complex. There still exists a road sign along Sembawang Road with this name. The elements were then transferred to Air Defence Operations Command (ADOC) in early 2007, and later, 3 Battalions were transferred to Participation Command (PC) in August that year. This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Chong Pang Camp
